title: QB musical chairs? Why the AFC North is struggling at the premier position
content: It's a bizarre time in the division with Aaron Rodgers the only starting QB who began 2025 in that capacity.

title: Concussion protocol for Giants' Dart under review
content: The NFL and NFLPA are reviewing the concussion protocol used in the evaluation of New York Giants rookie quarterback Jaxson Dart during Thursday night's game against the Philadelphia Eagles.

title: Source: Yankees' Bellinger to opt out of contract
content: The New York Yankees' Cody Bellinger plans to opt out of his contract and become a free agent next month, according to a source.

title: Source: Bucs WR Godwin likely out against 49ers
content: Buccaneers receiver Chris Godwin Jr. (fibula) is expected to miss Sunday's matchup against the 49ers, a source tells ESPN's Jeremy Fowler.

title: Jets LB Johnson to play after missing 3 games
content: Jets edge rusher Jermaine Johnson, who missed three games with an ankle injury, will play Sunday against the Broncos at London's Tottenham Hotspur Stadium.

title: Eagles RT Johnson calls for 'less predictable' attack
content: Eagles right tackle Lane Johnson said the offense needs to work hard to "keep defenses guessing" after Thursday night's 34-17 loss to the Giants.

title: Sister Jean, beloved Loyola-Chicago chaplain, dies
content: Sister Jean Dolores Schmidt, the longtime chaplain of the Loyola-Chicago men's basketball team, died Thursday at the age of 106. "[She] was an invaluable source of wisdom and grace for generations of students, faculty, and staff," the school said.

title: Dodgers advance to NLCS after Kerkering's error
content: The Dodgers beat the Phillies 2-1 on Thursday to advance to the NLCS. The Phillies' Orion Kerkering made a wild throw past home instead of throwing to first after mishandling a bases-loaded comebacker with two outs in the 11th inning.

title: Ex-Fins safety Jones awarded $9.5M in fraud suit
content: Former Dolphins safety Reshad Jones has settled a lawsuit against Merrill Lynch for $9.5 million after a former financial adviser allegedly stole $2.59 million from the two-time Pro Bowler.

title: 'You're just poking the bear': Bucs' Wirfs recalls fan heckling Baker in Seattle
content: Buccaneers left tackle Tristan Wirfs witnessed Baker Mayfield's trash-talking exchange with a Seattle Seahawks fan last Sunday.

content: Liverpool's Ibrahima KonatÃ©, Bayern Munich's Dayot Upamecano and Crystal Palace's Marc GuÃ©hi are on Real Madrid's short list. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: 'No reason to meet Xi': Trump on Chinaâ€™s rare earth move; warns of 'massive' tariff hike
content: President Trump accused China of a "sinister and hostile" move after Beijing imposed new export controls on rare earth elements. He warned of a "massive increase of tariffs" on Chinese goods in response, stating the timing was "especially inappropriate" and that the US would "financially counter their move."

title: Decline of dollar? Why gold prices are breaking all records; â€˜more reliable assetâ€™
content: Gold prices have surged to record highs, surpassing $4,000 per ounce internationally and Rs 1.2 lakh domestically. This rally is driven by concerns over the US economy, potential market overvaluation, and a shift towards alternative assets amid currency stability worries. Central banks are also significantly increasing gold reserves, further fueling the upward trend.

title: Several killed in blast at military explosives plant in Tennessee, US
content: A powerful explosion rocked a military explosives manufacturing facility in rural Tennessee on Friday morning, causing homes to shake and prompting an emergency response. Officials urged the public to stay clear as ongoing blasts prevented access to the site, with no immediate confirmation of casualties. Footage showed burning debris and smoke rising from the facility near Bucksnort.

title: Jyoti Singh meets PK: Pawan Singhâ€™s wife says want to protect women, don't want ticket
content: Jyoti Singh, wife of Bhojpuri actor Pawan Singh, met Prashant Kishor, denying any political aspirations. She stated her visit aimed to advocate for women facing injustice, not to seek an election ticket. Kishor confirmed her focus on personal safety and experiences, with Jan Suraaj offering support for her security.  Recent marital tensions with Pawan Singh have been highlighted.

title: Microsoft engineer quits: emails thousands of staff; says can't enable war
content: A senior Microsoft engineer has resigned protesting the company's cloud contracts with the Israeli military. Scott Sutfin-Glowski cited enabling potential atrocities as his reason for leaving. This follows months of internal dissent and employee firings over Gaza-related demonstrations. Microsoft previously stopped some services to an Israeli intelligence unit after a report. However, many contracts remain active, and employee protests continue. Activists demand a complete cut of ties with Israel.

title: IND vs WI: India coach warns Sai despite 87 - 'He very much knows that'
content: India's batting coach Sitanshu Kotak identified a technical flaw in Sai Sudharsan's back foot play after his dismissal for 87. Kotak is working with the mentally strong youngster to refine this aspect, aiming to prevent him from playing back to overly full deliveries. Sudharsan's impressive innings, alongside Yashasvi Jaiswal's century, put India in a dominant position.

title: Nobel Peace Prize 2025: Trump lost - why the defeat will sting Pakistan more
content: Venezuelan opposition leader MarÃ­a Corina Machado won the 2025 Nobel Peace Prize for her efforts to promote democracy. Donald Trump, heavily backed by Pakistan for the prize, was snubbed despite his self-promotion and claims of peacemaking. Pakistanâ€™s public support for Trump now appears diplomatically costly. The Nobel Committee stressed that lobbying holds no sway, favouring enduring peace efforts over rhetoric and self-congratulation.

title: IND vs WI: Sai reveals plan for Day 2; it doesn't look good for Windies
content: India aims to bat West Indies out of the second Test, with Sai Sudharsan emphasizing the team's goal of a substantial first-innings total.  Sudharsan himself played a composed 87, drawing inspiration from his India A success and Shubman Gill's self-belief. The team seeks to replicate their dominant strategy from the previous Test.

title: â€˜Donâ€™t give your wealth to Bill Gatesâ€™: Thiel warned Musk on pledge; slammed â€˜leftistâ€™ nonprofits
content: Peter Thiel revealed he advised Elon Musk to reconsider the Giving Pledge, warning his fortune could end up with "left-leaning nonprofits" chosen by Bill Gates. Thiel expressed concern about global power structures and an "Antichrist" figure gaining control.

title: Delhi-bound AI Dreamliner diverts to Dubai; pilots' body seeks checks on B787s
content: An Air India Boeing 787 diverted to Dubai due to a technical snag, with its autopilot system failing. This follows another incident last week where a Dreamliner's ram air turbine deployed on approach. The Federation of Indian Pilots has urged the grounding of all B787s amid continuous electrical issues and called for a special audit of Air India's aircraft maintenance.

title: Bihar election: Opinion poll predicts NDA's edge; favours Tejashwi Yadav as CM face
content: An opinion poll by C Voter predicts a 40% chance for the NDA to retain power in Bihar, with the RJD-led Mahagathbandhan close behind at 38.3%. Tejashwi Yadav leads as the preferred chief ministerial candidate, while seat-sharing talks intensify among alliance partners.

title: Watch: Rohit's Lamborghini smashed outside training ground
content: Rohit Sharma trained intensely at Shivaji Park for the upcoming Australia tour, showcasing his signature shots against pace and spin. Fans gathered to watch the former captain, who also reportedly hit his Lamborghini during the session. Rohit, aged 38, will return to ODI action against Australia after a break, having recently added a Tesla to his car collection.

title: Google changes work policy: â€˜Work From Anywhereâ€™ canâ€™t be used for WFH; sends memo
content: Google is tightening its "Work from Anywhere" policy, now counting any day worked remotely outside the office as a full week. This change, separate from the existing hybrid schedule, aims to prevent WFA from substituting regular remote work. Employees are also restricted from using WFA days to work from other Google offices due to legal and financial concerns.

title: â€˜Pak Hindus have rights in Indiaâ€™: Shah defends SIR
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah has thrown his support behind the Election Commission's electoral roll revision, asserting that infiltrators on voter lists undermine the Constitution. He emphasized that only citizens should decide national leadership and differentiated between refugees seeking religious refuge and infiltrators entering illegally for economic gain. Shah also cited census data to support his claims regarding population shifts.

title: Kabul bombing: Taliban terms it 'provocative act' by Pak; sends big warning from Indian soil
content: Afghanistan's Taliban government has accused Pakistan of bombing a border town and violating its sovereignty, following explosions in Kabul.  Meanwhile, India and Afghanistan declared Pakistan-sponsored cross-border terrorism a shared threat.  New Delhi will upgrade its technical mission in Kabul to an embassy, and Kabul assured India it won't allow its territory to be used against Indian interests.

title: IND vs WI: Gambhir, Bumrahâ€™s epic reaction goes viral after Gill wins first toss - Watch
content: Shubman Gill celebrated his maiden Test toss win as India's captain, ending a six-match streak. Opting to bat first against West Indies in New Delhi, Gill maintained the winning XI from the previous Test. The team's jovial reaction highlighted strong camaraderie, with coach Gambhir and players sharing light-hearted banter about the long-awaited victory.

title: Micah Parsons slams Eaglesâ€™ â€˜tush pushâ€™, calls it trash and unfair to real football
content: Micah Parsons labeled the Philadelphia Eagles' 'tush push' play "trash" and "not football" after their recent loss to the Giants. This controversial quarterback sneak variation, despite its legality, faces increasing criticism from players and coaches due to its high success rate and perceived unfair advantage, fueling pressure on the NFL to review the tactic.

title: No Nobel Peace Prize, but Trump just got more ammo to go after Venezuela president Maduro
content: Venezuelan opposition leader Maria Corina Machado wins the 2025 Nobel Peace Prize, bolstering US President Trump's tough stance against Nicolas Maduro's regime. The award highlights democratic values and human rights, providing Trump with ideological backing for potential escalated actions against alleged authoritarianism and drug trafficking in Venezuela.

title: Exclusive | At 20! Once promised pair of sunglasses, Esha has WC gold
content: Esha Singh secured her first senior World Cup gold in 10m air pistol by a narrow margin. Initially a hobby, shooting became her profession after early success. She trains in challenging conditions like rain. Singh also follows racing, her father's sport, and may pursue it professionally after shooting. Her journey highlights India's growing talent in the sport.

title: Trisha Krishnan addresses Chandigarh wedding rumours with humour
content: Trisha Krishnan, the ever-poised South superstar, recently tackled fresh rumours about her personal life with her signature wit. The actress, who has been the subject of chatter claiming she is set to marry a Chandigarh-based businessman, took to Instagram to set the record straight.

title: â€˜Only Rajesh Khullar helped meâ€™: Deceased Haryana IPS officerâ€™s suicide note reveals new details
content: A senior Haryana IPS officer died by suicide, naming 16 officers for harassment in his note. Among them, Chief Principal Secretary Rajesh Khullar was the only one mentioned for offering genuine support. Khullar had intervened twice, dictating notes to re-examine the matters and keep proceedings in abeyance, but the officer felt further harassed as information was leaked to the media.

title: Pak violence over pro-Palestine march: 2 killed, 50 wounded in clashes in Lahore
content: Violent clashes erupted in Lahore as police used batons and tear gas to stop thousands of Islamist protesters from marching towards Islamabad. The TLP organization claims two supporters died and 50 were injured since Thursday. Authorities have blocked roads and cut internet services to prevent the demonstration.

title: 'I tried committing suicide': Cricketer reveals gory details - Watch
content: Tazmin Brits has made an extraordinary comeback to cricket after a serious car accident. Her determination and a chance encounter with a provincial coach paved her way back. Brits' brilliant century against New Zealand in the World Cup solidified her as a key player, showcasing her resilience and ability to perform under pressure.

title: Ashton Hall net worth 2025: Inside the internet starâ€™s stunning fortune
content: Ashton Hall, a fitness influencer, transformed his passion into a lucrative career, building a loyal following and launching his own supplement brand.  His dedication, evident in his viral morning routine, has led to an estimated net worth of $2 million by 2025. Hall's journey from aspiring NFL player to fitness mogul highlights the power of discipline and entrepreneurship.

title: BMW India achieves best-ever sales with GST 2.0 boost: iX1 top EV model
content: BMW Group India has recorded its best-ever January-September performance, selling 11,978 cars with a 13% rise. The July-September quarter saw a significant 21% jump. Demand for long wheelbase models and SUVs surged, while electric vehicle sales exploded by 246%, making EVs 21% of total car sales. BMW Motorrad also saw robust motorcycle sales.

title: 'Contiguous neighbour': EAM calls Pak 'threat' for India and Afghanistan; sends clear message on PoK
content: India's External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar highlighted Pakistan-sponsored cross-border terrorism as a shared threat during talks with Afghan counterpart Amir Khan Muttaqi. He stressed coordinated efforts against terrorism, noting Afghanistan's sensitivity to India's security concerns. Muttaqi affirmed Afghanistan's commitment against elements threatening others and praised India's humanitarian aid.

title: Ancient fungi shaped Earthâ€™s first ecosystems billions of years before plants
content: New research reveals fungi, not plants, were Earth's first land colonizers, emerging hundreds of millions of years earlier. These ancient fungi partnered with algae, recycled nutrients, and built proto-soils, stabilizing surfaces and releasing essential elements. This groundbreaking discovery shows fungi created the foundational ecosystems that paved the way for plants and all terrestrial life.

title: IND vs WI: Unbeaten Jaiswal 173; India reach 318/2 at stumps on Day 1
content: Yashasvi Jaiswal scored an unbeaten 173 runs on day one of the second Test against West Indies. India reached 318 runs for the loss of two wickets. Jaiswal shared a significant partnership with Sai Sudharsan. India aims for a series clean sweep. The West Indies team seeks to avoid another whitewash.

title: 'Will expand circle of peace': Netanyahu says Israeli forces remain in Gaza until Hamas disarms
content: Israel's Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu announced an expansion of peace efforts as a ceasefire with Hamas commenced. He stated that hostages would be returned soon and Israeli forces would remain in Gaza to ensure Hamas disarms. Thousands of displaced Palestinians began returning home following the agreement, which was facilitated by talks in Egypt and a US peace plan.

title: 'Trained engineer': Venezuela's Machado wins Nobel Peace Prize - whatâ€™s her academic background?
content: MarÃ­a Corina Machado, a Venezuelan industrial engineer and opposition leader, has won the 2025 Nobel Peace Prize for her relentless fight for democracy against authoritarian rule. Her journey from academia to activism reflects a fusion of technical precision and civic courage. Founder of SÃºmate and leader of Vente Venezuela, Machado has endured persecution, exile, and political bans. Her engineering mindset underpins her approach to governance, showing that democracy, like any system, requires constant, principled maintenance.

title: Nobel snub: Donald Trump misses out on Peace Prize - why he lost
content: Venezuelan pro-democracy leader Maria Corina Machado has been awarded the 2025 Nobel Peace Prize for her unwavering fight against NicolÃ¡s Maduro's regime and her advocacy for free elections. The committee's decision, made prior to any recent geopolitical events, firmly excludes US President Donald Trump, who had expressed expectations for the award. Machado's courage in the face of persecution inspires millions.

title: Alexis Ohanian recalls momâ€™s deportation fears as ICE raids tear families apart
content: Alexis Ohanian, husband of Serena Williams, spoke out against recent ICE arrests, sharing his personal connection as the son of an undocumented immigrant. He emphasized the importance of "smart borders and humane immigration reform" that includes a fair legalization plan, rather than breaking up families.

title: Todd McLellan slams Red Wings after fans boo team off the ice
content: Detroit Red Wings' home opener was a dismal 5-1 defeat to Montreal, drawing boos from frustrated fans. New coach Todd McLellan accepted the criticism, demanding accountability for defensive lapses and poor execution. He stressed the need for disciplined, fundamentally sound hockey, not just effort, as the team prepares to regroup and face Toronto.

title: Watch: Patna metro station filled with gutka stains in 3 days
content: Barely days after its inauguration, Patna Metro stations are already marred by red gutka stains. A viral video highlights the widespread vandalism, with walls, stairs, and platforms defaced. A frustrated citizen expressed dismay at the public's disregard for the new infrastructure, questioning civic sense.

title: Russell Wilson benched vs Eagles: Giants QBâ€™s emotional message to wife Ciara
content: The New York Giants have benched veteran quarterback Russell Wilson for Jaxson Dart in their Week 6 game against the Eagles, marking Wilson's third consecutive game on the sidelines due to performance issues. Despite professional challenges, Wilson finds strength in his family, including wife Ciara and their children, and remains ready to contribute if called upon.

title: RBI realtime cheque clearance : Customers complain, bank staff not fully trained
content: India's new real-time cheque clearance system is experiencing initial problems. Bank staff are facing challenges with new processes, and technical glitches are slowing down cheque processing. Customers report delays in payments. The Reserve Bank of India is working to resolve these issues. The system aims for same-day clearance, replacing older methods. Bankers expect smooth operations soon.

title: McDavid faces backlash for blunt comments on young players after extension
content: Connor McDavid has signed a two-year, $25 million extension with the Edmonton Oilers, accepting below-market value to prioritize winning now.  His decision reflects the team's limited youth due to past trades, creating a tight window for a Stanley Cup.  General Manager Stan Bowman highlighted McDavid's team-first approach, emphasizing the immediate goal of championship contention.

title: In Sabarimala gold theft, a Vijay Mallya connection
content: Pandalam Palace representatives are demanding a thorough investigation into how gold sheets, gifted by Vijay Mallya in 1998 for the Sabarimala Dwarapalaka idol, allegedly turned non-gold by 2019. They question the capability of repair sponsors and the negligence in procedures, urging accountability for those involved in the temple's upkeep.

title: China-US tensions: Beijing hits US ships with â€˜special port feesâ€™
content: China will implement "special port fees" on US-built or operated ships starting October 14, with charges of 400 yuan per net tonne. This retaliatory measure mirrors US port fees imposed on Chinese vessels, aiming to protect Chinese shipping companies' interests. Beijing urges Washington to reverse its actions.

title: Son of Pulwama martyr, Rahul selected for Haryana U19; Sehwag: 'It has been my privilege'
content: Rahul Soreng, whose father died in the Pulwama attack, has been selected for the Haryana Under-19 cricket team. Former Indian opener Virender Sehwag congratulated Rahul. Sehwag International School provides free education and boarding for children of martyrs. Rahul has been studying at the school since 2019. This selection marks a significant achievement for Rahul and his family.

title: Amid Cough Syrup Deaths, Auditor Flags Madhya Pradesh's Mega Purchase Of Banned Drugs
content: Even as Madhya Pradesh reels from the tragic deaths of 23 children in Chhindwara due to a toxic cough syrup, a new revelation from the Comptroller and Auditor General has exposed a deeper crisis in the state's drug regulation and procurement system.

title: NDA Cadet, 18, Found Hanging In Hostel Near Pune, Family Claims He Was Harassed
content: An 18-year-old first-year cadet of the prestigious National Defence Academy (NDA) was found hanging in his hostel room on Friday morning in Khadakwasla near Pune.

title: Gautam Singhania To Attend NDTV World Summit 2025: All About Raymond Chairman
content: Gautam Singhania, Chairman of Raymond Group, is among the industry leaders attending the NDTV World Summit 2025 in New Delhi.

title: Aaron Chatterji At NDTV World Summit: Meet OpenAI's 1st Chief Economist
content: Aaron "Ronnie" Chatterji, OpenAI's first Chief Economist, is attending the NDTV World Summitin New Delhi.

title: Who Is Nick Brooker, Co-Founder Of IndoGenius Set To Attend NDTV World Summit
content: Nick Booker, the co-founder at IndoGenius, will be among the attendees and speakers at the NDTV World Summit in New Delhi.

title: Who Is Nitin Mittal, Deloitte Principal And WSJ's Bestselling Author Set To Attend NDTV World Summit
content: Nitin Mittal, Deloitte Principal, Global AI Leader, and author of the WSJ bestseller All-in on AI, is among the leaders attending the NDTV World Summit.

title: Senior Cop's Relative Dies After 2 Constables Assault Him, Seek Bribe
content: A 22-year-old man in Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal died on Friday following an assault by two police constables.

title: Silence Is Surrender, Tell Your Story Or Others Will Rewrite It: Gautam Adani
content: "If we do not narrate who we are, others will rewrite who we were," Adani Group Chairman Gautam Adani said on Friday, calling for India to take charge of its global narrative through cinema, storytelling, and emerging technologies.

title: Taliban Minister's Message From Indian Soil To Pakistan On Terrorism
content: Terror groups like the Lashkar-e-Taiba and Jaish-e-Mohammad have long operated from Afghan soil. But Taliban has wiped out all terrorists in the last four years, claimed visiting Foreign Minister Amir Khan Muttaqi during his India visit.

title: Tata Trusts' "Cordial" Board Meet Amid Tata Sons Row: Sources
content: The Tata Trusts' board met Friday and discussed routine issues in a "cordial" manner, said sources, amid murmurs of a rift among the trustees over board appointments and governance issues.

title: "Best Time To Invest In India Is Next Decade": Ace Investor Ramesh Damani
content: Among the most respected and famous investors in India, Manish Chokhani and Ramesh Damani shared market wisdom for the next generation to create wealth in a free-wheeling discussion at NDTV Profit IGNITE in Mumbai.

title: 48,646 Species Now At Risk Of Extinction: World's Top Conservation Body
content: Arctic seals and birds are coming under increasing threat, mainly due to climate change and human activity, according to an updated list of endangered species released Friday by the world's top conservation body.

title: 190-Million-Year-Old 'Sword Dragon' Found On Britain's Jurassic Coast
content: A skeleton found on Britain's Jurassic Coast has been identified as a new species of ichthyosaur, a type of prehistoric marine reptile that once ruled the seas, scientists said Friday.

title: Number Of Executions In US This Year Could Be Highest Since 2012
content: Thirty-five men have died by court-ordered executions in the US so far this year, including one early Friday, with seven others scheduled to be put to death later this month.

title: Trump, Who Long Coveted Nobel Peace Prize, Misses Out
content: US President Donald Trump was passed over for the Nobel Peace Prize on Friday despite jockeying from his fellow Republicans, various world leaders and most vocally himself.

title: Israel Says Gaza Ceasefire Now In Effect, Raising Hopes Of Ending War
content: A ceasefire between Israel and Hamas came into effect in Gaza on Friday, the military said, hours after Israel's Cabinet approved a deal to pause the fighting and exchange the remaining hostages for Palestinian prisoners.

title: Venezuelan Leader Maria Corina Machado Awarded Nobel Peace Prize 2025
content: Venezuela's Maria Corina Machado has been awarded the Nobel Peace Prize for her work in promoting democracy and fighting dictatorship in her country.

title: Opinion: Opinion | The Northeasterner: Indian, Until Someone Needs A Punchline - By Vir Sanghvi
content: The racism we casually throw at those from the North East is not so different - or any less offensive - from the racism that Indians face in the West. Yet, we remain blind to it.

title: Chandigarh Police Constitutes SIT In Haryana Police Officer's 'Suicide' Case
content: The Chandigarh Police on Friday constituted a six-member Special Investigation Team (SIT) to investigate the 'suicide' case of senior Haryana police officer Y Puran Kumar for "prompt, impartial and thorough investigation" in a time-bound manner.

title: 'I Want To See My Home': Gazans Return As Israel, Hamas Truce Takes Effect
content: Tens of thousands of Palestinians were starting to walk north to return to their homes Friday after the Israeli military said the ceasefire agreement with Hamas came into effect

title: What you absolutely need to know for every NFL game in Week 6 -- including final score predictions
content: the Bucs host the 49ers for a showdown between 4-1 teams . the Lions visit the Chiefs' Arrowhead Stadium for the second time in three seasons . we have you covered with everything you need to know .

title: 'Let children celebrate': NCR states urge SC to lift ban on crackers
content: The TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide. With an unwavering commitment to excellence in journalism, our team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics. title: Preview: Key conference matchups, Oklahoma's 'Dog Pound' defense and more
content: this year's preseason no. 1 and no. 2 teams have dropped out of the top 25 . this week's slate presents three matchups of ranked teams . the slate includes three matches of rated teams: no.1 Ohio State, no. 8 Alabama at no. 14 Missouri .

title: Prestige patriarch TT Jagannathan passes away at 77
content: TT Jagannathan, chairman emeritus of the TTK Group, passed away in Bengaluru on October 9 . he was the force behind the Prestige brand that transformed Indiaâ€™s kitchens . his pioneering gasket-release system set new safety standards for pressure cookers and turned Prestige into a household name .

title: MAGA meltdown after Trump is snubbed, Nobel Peace Prize goes to Venezuelan activist
content: president Donald Trump's MAGA minions went into major meltdown on friday . he was awarded the 2025 peace prize to venezuelan democracy activist Maria Corina Machado . white house officials vent their fury at the rebuff even as the Norwegian government bunkered for the blowback .

title: Roy Williams' Superman dive and more iconic Red River Rivalry moments
content: the annual showdown between the Texas Longhorns and Oklahoma Sooners brings a memorable atmosphere . this year, intrigue about the game is especially high, as Texas began the season as the no. 1 team in the country but is still in search of its first win against a power conference opponent . the availability of John Mateer is uncertain after a hand injury sustained earlier in the season .

title: Premier League depth charts for most popular teams
content: the premier league season is seven games in and the transfer window is closed until Jan. 1 . there will be no more incomings or outgoings unless a free agent can be snapped up . here are depth charts of the best options for the first XI .

title: Game 4 guide: Keys to an Aces sweep -- or Mercury extending the series
content: the Phoenix Mercury are attempting to do something that no team has ever done in the WNBA or NBA . they have shown signs of life in this series, fighting back against the Aces' dominance with two of the three games decided by a combined five points . however, the Mercury have failed to get a win in the finals .

title: Nobel Peace Prize 2025: Meet the winner Maria Corina Machado - why she got top award
content: At TOI World Desk, our dedicated team of seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sifts through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock. With an unwavering commitment to accuracy, depth, and timeliness, we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, delivering a nuanced understanding of international affairs to our readers. Join us on a journey across continents as we unravel the stories that shape our interconnected world. Read More

title: Biharâ€™s ruling parties lose some more leaders to RJD
content: A former JD(U) MP, a former MLA, and the son of a sitting MP switch over, along with a former candidate of the Lok Janshakti Party (Ram Vilas)

title: National Conference names candidates for J&K Rajya Sabha polls, drops Farooq Abdullah for â€˜health reasonsâ€™
content: Farooq Abdullah, elected to the Lok Sabha for the first time in 1980 at the age of 43, has been the partyâ€™s longest-serving parliamentarian in both the Houses from 2002 to 2014

title: Southern Discom to upgrade transformers in areas with high load growth soon
content: Several substations, lines in and around Hyderabad to have 16 MVA PTRs, 1,000 kVA DTRs to bear higher loads

title: Cough syrup deaths: Tamil Naduâ€™s Sresan Pharma owner brought to M.P.â€™s Chhindwara, sent to 10-day police custody
content: Police interrogate owner on manufacturing processes, personnel involved in manufacturing, quality checks; â€œhighly unusualâ€ that 46% toxic substances could be added by mistake or negligence, say police

title: Maharashtra government announces draft rules for app-based aggregators of public transport vehicles
content: These rules are applicable to the app-based public transport services, including e-rickshaws, Ola, Uber, Rapido, and others, aiming for discipline, transparency and passenger safety in services

title: 2,200 schools do not have permanent physical education teachers: Minister
content: Only 281 permanent physical education teachers work in upper primary schools and 1,508 in high schools

title: Human-wildlife conflict mitigation measures reviewed
content: Authorities to identify specific wildlife species and the regions most prone to human-wildlife conflict

title: SC seeks Centre, EC response on plea challenging voting bar on undertrials
content: Petition urges court to reconsider â€˜blanket disqualificationâ€™ of prisoners from voting, calls for limited and individualised restrictions

title: Kozhikode cyber police nab key suspect in alleged â‚¹1.2 crore financial fraud
content: The suspect was detained after police analysed and collected digital evidence related to the fund transfers against him

title: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu lauds â€˜Save The Bullâ€™ initiative
content: An innovative initiative of the Chinta Sasidhar Foundation, a bull-powered treadmill system generates 4 KW when a single bull walks on it for four hours a day

title: A.P. Womenâ€™s Commission to launch online portal for swift redressal of womenâ€™s grievances
content: Chairperson Rayapati Sailaja announces new initiative, emphasises continuous awareness and strict action against harassment and social media abuse

title: Pallium India appeals to WHO for special palliative care strategy for Global South
content: On the occasion of the World Hospice and Palliative Care Day on October 11, low and middle income countries, including India, are nowhere near the goal of Universal Health Coverage, including palliative care, set for 2030

title: NorthEast United FC keeps a seat empty as tribute to Zubeen at India-Singapore tie
content: The Highlander Brigade, as the club is popularly known, recalled how Garg had said that football was his first love

title: 6.9-magnitude aftershock strikes Philippines hours after 7.4 earthquake that killed six

title: Planners and architects will play key role in achieving â€˜Viksit Bharatâ€™, says IIT Tirupati Director
content: At SPA Vijayawadaâ€™s ninth convocation, K.N. Satyanarayana highlights sustainability, technology, heritage, and human-centric design as the four drivers of Indiaâ€™s future cities, while emphasizing closer collaboration with IIT Tirupati and the role of graduates in building inclusive, innovative urban spaces

title: Spurious liquor racket has exposed TDPâ€™s double standards, says Perni Nani
content: The TDP leaders are trying to downplay the cases instead of pursuing them thoroughly, alleges the YSRCP leader

title: Lalu to take final call on candidate selection for Bihar polls, says RJD
content: State and parliamentary committee members seek representation for all sections, with special focus on EBCs, a key vote bank; meeting also discusses seat allocation among INDIA bloc partners

title: After Ministerâ€™s tirade, Keralaâ€™s MVD officials flock to vehicle flag-off event; dept. work gets disrupted
content: Transport Minister Ganesh Kumar had cancelled the scheduled flag-off of 52 vehicles on Sept. 29 citing low attendance at the venue

title: â€˜Viprotasavaâ€™ convention in Dharwad from October 12 to 15
content: The Akhila Karnataka State-level Shukla Yajurvedi Viprotasava convention will be held in Dharwad from October 12 to 15

title: Govt. will address shortage of clinical psychologists in Andhra Pradesh: Health Minister
content: Satya Kumar Yadav announces plans to set up a State mental health advisory board chaired by psychiatrist Indla Ramasubba Reddy, highlighting the governmentâ€™s efforts to tackle rising mental health issues

title: President Murmu offers prayers at Somnath Temple, visits Gir National Park
content: President Droupadi Murmu pays homage to Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel, as part of three-day visit to Gujarat

title: Jagan deliberately spreading falsehood on PPP model of developing medical colleges, alleges BJP
content: When land, seats, fee, and regulations remain under government control, how can it be called privatisation, questions party leader Yamini Sarma

title: Congress and BJP accuse former TDB president and CPI(M) leader Padmakumar of entrusting Ayyappaâ€™s sacred objects to his son for restoration
content: Padmakumar says the TDB had placed on the official record the transfer of the sacred objects to his son for repair. He says the entrusting of the overhaul was transparent and not surreptitious as alleged by the Opposition parties.

title: Kerala HC seeks report on steps taken to ensure safety of doctors, staff at hospitals
content: Tighten security measures at hospitals, especially at entry points, submits counsel for Indian Medical Association

title: â€˜Vision 2031â€™ outlines roadmap for Keralaâ€™s transition from food security to nutritional security
content: Seminar lays stress on tackling nutrition and health challenges by leveraging the Stateâ€™s public distribution system

title: Cabinet okays â‚¹212 crore for Governorâ€™s Complex in Amaravati
content: The project includes Governorâ€™s Mansion, Assembly Darbar Hall, Governorâ€™s Office, and residential quarters for officials and staff; four convention centres in the capital region also get green signal

title: Collector reviews arrangements for Prime Minister Modiâ€™s visit to Srisailam on October 16
content: Rajakumari calls for strict coordination among all the departments and timely completion of assigned tasks

title: Sewage pollution: notices issued to apartment units yet to submit affidavit before PCB
content: Seven apartment units along the Thevara-Perandoor and Edappally canals were issued notices as they had failed to respond to an earlier directive to submit an undertaking requesting a reasonable time to set up sewage treatment plants

title: Union Minister reviews redevelopment works at Kozhikode railway station
content: The redevelopment of Kozhikode railway station aims to transform it into a modern, passenger-friendly terminal equipped with upgraded infrastructure, enhanced amenities, and improved aesthetics in line with Indian Railwaysâ€™ vision for world-class stations

title: Ministers should check spurious liquor menace, says Andhra Pradesh IT Minister Lokesh
content: In the wake of the recent expose by the Excise Department in Annamayya district, he expresses concern over the damage being caused by such illegal activities to the party politically

title: Shadow over continuation of Kannada medium engineering courses as they fail to attract students for the fourth year in a row
content: Former VTU Vice Chancellorâ€™s proposal to the State government, urging it to provide reservation in the government engineering recruitments for those from Kannada medium, has received no response

title: Munambam land not a Waqf property, says Kerala High Court
content: A Division Bench of the court consisting of Justice Sushrut Arvind Dharmadhikari and Justice V.M. Syam Kumar criticised the entire exercise of the Kerala Waqf Board (KWB) in the Munambam case as a â€œshamâ€ and noted that the board â€œacted as a sheer land grabber eyeing on the subject property, which had assumed high value due to commercial developments in the last few decades.â€

title: Nobody believed in GO.9 issued for BC quota hike for local bodies polls: BRS
content: Senior leader B. Vinod Kumar says 69% quota to BCs is only for education, employment in Tamil Nadu and not for local bodies polls

title: Political conspiracy behind controversies dogging Sabarimala, says Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan
content: Says the allegations were intended to torpedo Left Democratic Front (LDF) governmentâ€™s bid to forge a consensus among stakeholders, including devotees and Hindu social organisations, for the shrineâ€™s development into a major international spiritual destination

title: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu inaugurates â‚¹340-crore bio-ethanol plant in Nellore
content: Established by the Vishwa Samudra Group, the facility supplements farmersâ€™ income and supports Indiaâ€™s ethanol blending goals, besides generating direct employment to 250 people and indirect employment to over 300

title: Politics of intimidation against Dalits a threat to democracy, says Congress
content: Law Minister Arjun Ram Meghwal slams Rahul Gandhi for â€œspreading lies and inciting hatred through social mediaâ€ and linking death of IPS officer with the violence against the Chief Justice of India
